snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio suggested that changes under his administration had already eased the burden on officers’ time, even as crime remained relatively low.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio unveils $78.3 billion budget containing proposals to reduce income inequality, but not allowing for hiring more police officers; police spokesman says talks with City Hall will continue.

byline.original: By MATT FLEGENHEIMER and NIKITA STEWART

lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio suggested that changes under his administration had already eased the burden on officers’ time, even as crime remained relatively low.

headline.main: Mayor de Blasio’s Latest Budget Won’t Pay for More Police Officers
headline.print_headline: De Blasio’s Latest Budget Won’t Pay for More Officers
